instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Hi guys, I know this isn't a macbook, but I'm running out of ideas.

I have a hp g6 come in for no mouse problem.
I've googled the issue and found a few different solutions, how ever the ones I've tried didnt work.

I've tried another trackpad, didnt work.

I figure it's a board issue.

One of the YouTube clips I watched was in a different language which I under stool 7% of.
seemed he was blaming the CPU.

I have to hp g6
this one I'm talking about and another I got in a year ago with a USB problem, it never got fixed and customer left it with me..

anyone else had this issue wissua hp g6 ?

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: You must post the motherboard model...

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Ok sorry about that.
here is a puck

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
That is Quanta R53 board.
Check first for 3V at pin 3/CN11.
Be sure L38/39 are OK.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
That is Quanta R53.
Check 3V at pin 3/CN11 and L38/39 presence.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Voltage on pin 3/cnn1  3.397v
L39 is 17.6mv
L38 is is 3.396v

thanks for any help you can provide

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
"L39 is 17.6mv"
Both pins?
Check R254.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Yes on both pins.
however R254 is 3.396v on one side and 17.6mv on the other
and its looks suspect.

Can I run a jumper from pin 1 that has the 3.396v to pin L39 ?

Is that resistor super important ?

The other g6 I have has a USB problem, I would love to fix!
So not super ksun on using it as a doner.
however I have Heaps of doner iPhone boards if they have the same value

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
You must change R254, NOT bypass it.
That is the pull-up resistor for TPCLK signal.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Is it a common resistor ?
I have several laptops I can use as donor bosrds

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
4.7 Kohms, any size you can fit there.
You can use one in the range of 3K3-6K2...

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Ok I swapped the r251 from my other board, reason I swapped that instead of R254 is because I got the same reading on both boards 17.6mv so figured they was both no good checked the schematics to find a match, R251 is a match according to the schematics I have.

Swapped it over just to get the same reading.
so I'm still getting 17.6mv even after swapping R251 with R254.

There must be a problem on TPCLK signal.
I cant find a board view for this laptop.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: Post diode mode to ground on TPCLK y TPDATA lines.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Check if keyboard has a comination (Fn + something else) to enable/disable touchpad.
Sometime could be a separate button near the touchpad.
Or just a small hole marked point to doble click it.
Also look in Bios Setup for such option...

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
I tried a reinstall of windows and that achieved nothing, figured if it was toggled of by  function off-key it would have reset it to the on position.
I've checked bios and there is not much in there.

Both laptops have the same problem.
the g6 I already had originally had issue with the USB ports.
You could o ly use one at a time.

I will post diode to ground on them two lines tomorrow morning.
its 11pm here, im of to bed.

I really appreciate the time you invest into helping direct me, and not just me but everyone.

Be blessed, talk tomorrow

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: did you start with reflashing EC+Main Bios? do you have "advanced" mode for trackpad in bios settings?

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
No, do I flash it with a stock bios rom from hp?
no the bios is very basic, nearly looks like things are missing

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Diode reading is
TPCLK is 0.00i4
TPDATA is 0.460

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
"TPCLK is 0.00i4"
???
Compare with a good board; supposedly should be less than 1% diference.
Check the value w/ and w/o touchpad connected.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
On the other g6 I have measurement is is
TPCLK 0.007
TPDATA 0.449

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Too low value on TPCLK, practically short...
Check what I told above.
Also remove C509 and check again.
If still low, bad KBC.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Ok so I have checked the diode mode on 2 diffirent hp g6 quanta r53 with a different multimeter, talk about trolled...
On mine
TPCLK 0.758
TPDATA 0.758
On the customers
TPCLK 0.760
TPDATA 0.760
Sorry about that.

I've also noticed on one of the touthpads there is a short to ground on what goes to pins 3,6,7
on the other touchpad ground is only on pins 6,7

But I tried both touch pads.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
"TPCLK 0.007
--------------
TPCLK 0.758"
So???
I got confused...

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Yes me too..
stupid multimeter, using my new one now.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Touchpad still not working.
Mouse only appears when I plug in USB mouse

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Its 0.758
other multimeter is reading wrong

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Pin 3/CN11 cannot be short to ground; there is +3VSUS.
Be sure to have correct volatge on both boards.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Update.
I found the problem with the touch pad pin that was short to ground.
there is a cap ( C2 ) that turned into a wire.

I can not find the value for it, do you have any idea how I can find the value to replace it.

or is it a cap that can be left off?

It's on the touch pad it self, doesnt seem to be on the schematics I have.

Thanks

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: Here is touch pad details.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: Try without it at least...

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Tries, didnt work.
but there is a resistor near it, I'm wondering if it went with the cap.

Any idea where I can find a schamatics for the track pad?

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message: I don't think schematic for trackpad is available... Just replace it or get one for compare....

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Good news.
I checked the touch pad again and found a few pins that got slightly bent from been pushed in and out so many times 

I fixed them up and now it is working without that capacitor!

Will this cause damage to the computer if I continue to use it like it is ?

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
You cannot damage it working without that small cap.
It should be some kind of EMI filter...
Test it and see if no issue appears on touchpad sensitivity.

threads.title: Hp g6 no mouse
threads.message:
Just an update.
I got both laptops working, thank you very much for taking time to help me work out the problem and a solution.

I have also been able to repair other laptops using diode mode.
didnt realise how helpful it is.

Thanks
